subject: Real Estate
title: Title Insurance: Protection Against the Past
description: A micro-lesson that makes Title Insurance: Protection Against the Past usable.

hook.text: Title insurance protects you against problems that happened before you bought the property.

buildup.text: A one-time premium at closing covers claims from forged documents, unknown liens, or recording errors.

discovery.text: Unlike other insurance, title insurance looks backward. It covers past events, not future risks.

twist.text: The industry pays out less than 5% of premiums in claims â€” making it one of the most profitable insurance lines.

climax.text: Critics call it overpriced. Supporters say a single title defect can destroy hundreds of thousands in equity.

punchline.text: Title insurance guards your past, not your future.

quiz.question: What makes title insurance different from other insurance?
